getAlignmentDefs().Description: Returns read only definitions of alignment positions.

ClassDesc: Optional facet provided by @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#Adapter_E@ or @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#ViewHolder_E@ for use in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#HorizontalGridView_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#VerticalGridView_E@. Apps using @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter_E@ may set facet using @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter#setFacet_E@ or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter#ViewHolder#setFacet_E@. Facet on ViewHolder has a higher priority than Presenter or Adapter. ItemAlignmentFacet contains single or multiple @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@s. First @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@ describes the default alignment position for ViewHolder, it also overrides the default item alignment settings on @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#VerticalGridView_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#HorizontalGridView_E@ (see @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#BaseGridView#setItemAlignmentOffset_E@ etc). One ItemAlignmentFacet can have multiple @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@s, e.g. having two aligned positions when child1 gets focus or child2 gets focus. Grid view will visit focused view and its ancestors till the root of ViewHolder to match @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@s' @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentFocusViewId_E@. Once a match found, the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@ is used to calculate alignment position.
